intro: Jacquemontia ekmanii, commonly known as the Klamath trumpetflower, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes morning glories and other flowering vines. The plant is characterized by its distinctive trumpet-shaped, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Jacquemontia ekmanii is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks.
